title: Boy drowns in open drain in Ghaziabad; kin cite civic apathy

title: First separate budgets of city corporations to focus on parks, lakes and welfare funds
description: One of the focus areas in this year’s budgets will be municipal bonds, which allow urban local bodies to raise long-term funds directly from the market for capital-intensive infrastructure works such as roads, drains, parks and lakes.

title: Thousands rally against immigration enforcement in sub-zero Minnesota temperatures
description: The protests are part of a broader movement against President Donald Trump’s increased immigration enforcement across the state

title: Wife can’t claim maintenance if her action contributes to husband’s incapacity to earn: Allahabad High Court
description: The Court dismissed a revision petition of a woman seeking maintenance from her husband, a homeopathy doctor, who was allegedly shot at by his brother-in-law and father-in-law during an altercation at his clinic

description: 'Border 2' has made a powerful debut at the box office, exceeding expectations with an impressive Rs 30 crore net collection on its opening day. The war drama, starring Sunny Deol, secured a significant Rs 17 crore in advance bookings, positioning it among the highest first-day collections in Bollywood history.

description: He was found dead in the hostel located inside the college campus

description: This mission which was held from January 19 to January 22 looked at tapping into prospects in India’s fast-expanding green economy, according to a press release

description: Investigators suspect that inhalation of fumes from bug repellent tablets may have led to suffocation and caused his death

Telangana: 300 dog carcasses found dumped in Jagtial; mass killing toll rises to 900
description: Over 300 dog carcasses were discovered in a pit in Jagtial district, Telangana, following alleged mass killings. This incident brings the total number of deceased dogs in the state this month to nearly 900. Animal rights activists claim the killings were ordered by the village sarpanch, leading to an FIR against local officials.

title: 'Dhurandhar' crashes on day 50 after 'Border 2' release
description: 'Dhurandhar' marks 50 days at the box office, but with its lowest collection yet at Rs 55 lakh. Despite a strong run, the film's earnings dipped significantly in its eighth week. While its total net earnings are Rs 831.5 crore, it faces stiff competition, with 'Border 2' now posing a challenge.

title: HC grants Lokpal 2 more months to decide on CBI sanction to prosecute Moitra
WRD, World Bank to hold talks on Integrated Water Security project for Chennai Metropolitan Area
description: Officials discuss funding for implementing projects that could boost the city’s water security

title: Priyank Kharge writes to Centre to release pending grants for Gram Panchayats
description: The minister said that the central Government has been delaying the release of the grants for the financial year 2025-26, despite the state government’s timely submission of grant transfer certificates and Gram Panchayat Development plans.

title: Transmission lags behind RE power curtailment: MNRE Secy
On wettest January day in 2 years in Delhi, max temp falls by 11 degrees
No intention to act against Newslaundry journalist, clarifies HC
300 more killed, Telangana dog toll 900 in a month; sarpanch named in FIR
description: Approximately 300 dog carcasses were discovered in a pit in Jagtial district, Telangana, following alleged mass killings. Animal rights activists claim the incident occurred on Thursday, reportedly on the village sarpanch's orders. Police have registered an FIR against the sarpanch and gram panchayat secretary under relevant sections of the BNS and PCA Act.

title: Do good, earn grace
T20 WC row: Bangladesh stare at major financial hit; set to lose millions of dollars
description: Bangladesh's cricket board faces a potential crisis as the national team might withdraw from the T20 World Cup over security and national prestige concerns. This decision, linked to BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul, could cost the country millions in lost revenue and impact future tours. Players, while assured of match fees, miss a crucial global platform.

title: When teams said no: A look at ICC tournaments hit by refusals and withdrawals
description: Teams withdrawing from ICC events due to security and political concerns is a recurring issue. Notable instances include Australia and West Indies in 1996, England and New Zealand in 2003, Zimbabwe in 2009, Australia in 2016, and India's refusal to tour Pakistan in 2025. These decisions have significantly impacted major tournaments.

title: ‘Nammai Kakkum 48’ scheme benefits over 5 lakh people at city hospital
Census 2027 can open old wounds of demographic changes, says former CEC S.Y. Quraishi
Kerala man’s death: Trial by social media
description: A day after a woman posted a video on social media alleging sexual harassment by a man on a bus, he died by suicide. The episode sparked outrage across Kerala and led to heated discussions on the use of social media, the possible consequences of public shaming, and mental health. Mini Muringatheri reports on an episode that has divided society

title: FIR filed against 5 minor girls for allegedly making Hindu friend wear burqa
description: An FIR has been registered in Moradabad against five minor Muslim girls. They are accused of making their 16-year-old Hindu friend wear a burqa. The incident occurred on December 12, 2025. Police are investigating the matter following a complaint. The law carries a severe punishment for religious conversion by force or fraud.

title: Ukraine, Russia hold first direct talks on latest U.S. peace plan
description: The U.S. initially drafted a plan to end the conflict that was heavily criticised in Kyiv and western Europe for being too close to Russia's line, while later proposals were criticised by Moscow for floating the idea of European peacekeepers

title: Blue room, broken wall: Clues from 10-year-old help nab rape accused
description: Abandoned slippers and a broken wall in a forested ridge led police to crack a sexual assault case involving a 10-year-old girl. Investigators identified a red e-rickshaw with a white roof from CCTV footage, ultimately leading to the arrest of the 25-year-old suspect, Durgesh.

title: Poll bodies of 42 nations to work together on key issues
description: The participants also resolved to review their progress periodically and proposed to meet from December 3-5, 2026 at the India International Institute of Democracy and Election Management (IIIDEM)

title: 'Chemical kitchen': South Delhi police uncover major synthetic narcotics lab
description: South district police arrested a Nigerian national, Emmanuel, allegedly a kingpin in a synthetic drug operation. A "chemical kitchen" was discovered in his Devli residence, a factory for manufacturing high-end psychotropic substances like MDMA and heroin. The bust yielded 113 kg of raw materials, indicating local production and potential international cartel links.

title: Suspected Russia 'shadow fleet' tanker bound for French port
description: The tanker is now expected to arrive on Saturday morning at the port of Marseille-Fos in southern France

title: U.S. imposes sanctions on Iran 'shadow fleet' over protest crackdown
description: The Treasury Department took aim at nine vessels and their respective owners or management firms, which U.S. officials said "collectively transported hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of Iranian oil and petroleum products to foreign markets”

title: Adjourn West Bengal SIR hearing, file FIR if attacked: CEO
description: West Bengal's Chief Electoral Officer has directed district officials to immediately file FIRs against any destruction of public property or attacks on staff during SIR-related hearings. Hearings will be adjourned if violence persists, requiring CEO approval to resume. This directive follows an incident in Murshidabad where an MLA was not named in an FIR despite alleged vandalism and hate speech.

title: UN rights council decries ‘unprecedented’ crackdown in Iran, deepens scrutiny
description: With 25 votes in favour, seven opposed and the rest abstaining, it decided to extend and broaden the mandate of independent investigators gathering evidence towards ensuring accountability for rights violations in the country

title: Sri Lanka gets the better of England in the opening ODI
description: England overcame the early loss of Zak Crawley, who made a disappointing return to 50-over format after more than two years when he nicked Asitha Fernando behind wickets after scoring just 6 runs in his comeback game

title: Upset over Rahul 'snub', Tharoor skips poll meet with Cong brass, goes for lit fest instead
description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor missed a crucial Kerala leadership meeting, reportedly due to a perceived snub from Rahul Gandhi. While the party strategizes for the 2026 state polls and mends ties with allies, Tharoor's absence fuels speculation about his standing. Party leaders deny any internal discord, emphasizing unity for upcoming elections.

title: Kyle Jamieson replaces injured Adam Milne in New Zealand squad for T20 World Cup
description: New Zealand head coach Rob Walter said Milne, who wasn’t a part of the squad touring India, was getting himself ready for the T20 World Cup

title: Fear of failure might have crept into all of us: Rohit on 13-year ICC title drought
description: The former captain, who currently plays in the ODIs only, said the team management headlined by him and former head coach Rahul Dravid wanted to remove the fear by giving everyone freedom and clarity in their roles

title: Sindhu, Lakshya lose in quarterfinals; Indian challenge ends in Indonesia Masters
description: Sindhu, a two-time Olympic medallist, lost to top seed and world number four Chen Yu Fei of China 13-21 17-21 in the quarterfinal contest that lasted 42 minutes to bow out of the Super 500 event

title: Bangladesh does not deserve a govt aligned with radicals, says Sheikh Hasina
description: Tarique Rahman's return as BNP chairman is viewed critically, citing his exile and alleged corruption. The article questions the legitimacy of upcoming elections due to the ban on the Awami League, attributing it to fear of their popularity. It also highlights the government's failure to protect minorities and its appeasement of extremist forces, impacting India-Bangladesh relations.

title: Risk of PM, CM removal bill being misused: Legal experts
description: A proposed anti-corruption bill faces criticism from legal experts who warn that linking the removal of PMs, CMs, or ministers to 30 days of arrest on serious charges could be politically misused. Concerns were raised that this provision might override popular will, with some suggesting "framing of charges" as a more appropriate threshold for removal.

title: Mane, Sakshi better national record scores in air rifle trials
description: Sakshi shot 254.3 in the T2 final while Shahu Tushar Mane scored 637.1 in the qualification. Both these scores are better than the national record but they will not enter the official record books

Indian seafarers are most abandoned in the world again
description: Indian sailors faced the worst abandonment in 2025. Over 1,100 Indian seafarers were left stranded on ships. This marks a significant increase from previous years. Many were left without pay and unable to return home. The International Transport Workers’ Federation is working to recover wages. This situation highlights serious issues in the maritime industry.

Ishan Kishan's explosive 76 and Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 82 powered the chase, while Kuldeep Yadav's two wickets proved crucial in restricting the visitors.  The hosts comfortably overhauled New Zealand's 208-run target.

description: India’s first UCI 2.2 professional cycling race, the Pune Grand Tour, has impressed the sport’s global governing body, with the UCI considering an upgrade as early as next year. Praising organisation, international participation and fan response, UCI director general Amina Lanaya said Pune could become a reference race in Asia and even a future World Championships host.

The precious metal's surge is also attributed to its industrial applications and tight supply, with gold also trading near record levels.

description: New Zealand players donned black armbands in Raipur to mourn victims of severe storms and landslides back home. Despite the somber tribute, the Black Caps posted a strong 208/6 against India in the second T20I. Earlier, India's Suryakumar Yadav won the toss and chose to bowl, making key changes to their lineup.

title: RBI calls on states to follow Centre, frame ‘clear glide path’ to reduce debt

description: Actor-producer Vidnyan Mane has made explosive allegations against singer-composer Palaash Muchhal, claiming that he cheated Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and also duped him of over Rs 40 lakh in connection with an unreleased film. Mane has filed a formal complaint in Sangli, Maharashtra.

description: Republic Day, celebrated annually on January 26th, commemorates India's adoption of its Constitution in 1950, marking its transition to a republic. This day honors the nation's freedom, unity, and the fundamental rights and responsibilities enshrined in its Constitution. It's a time to reflect on the values that strengthen India and encourage responsible citizenship.

description: Say what you want about the French, they always know how to do things with style. Revolutions, republics, beheadings, exiles. Even their authoritarians have style. When Jean-Paul Sartre was arrested, Charles de Gaulle asked him to be released immediately, saying in a rather bathetic style: “One doesn’t arrest Voltaire.”

description: Hardik Pandya has achieved a significant milestone in Indian T20I cricket. He is now the second most capped player, surpassing Virat Kohli. Pandya's consistent performance with bat and ball highlights his enduring presence in the shortest format. This achievement places him in an exclusive group of Indian cricketers with over 100 T20 international appearances.

title: The great escape: When Pakistan's Hanif Mohammad batted four days to save Test
description: Hanif Mohammad's monumental 337 against the West Indies in 1958 secured Pakistan's first Test draw.  He batted for 970 minutes, showcasing incredible patience and resilience to save his team from defeat after following on. This innings remains the longest in Test cricket history by time.

description: Thalapathy Vijay's upcoming film 'Jana Nayagan' faces release postponement due to censor troubles and legal challenges. Vijay reportedly refuses to cut controversial political dialogues, viewing them as the film's core message ahead of his anticipated political entry. A crucial Madras High Court verdict on January 27 will determine the film's fate.

description: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin rejected Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'double engine' government pitch, asserting the state has achieved growth independently. Stalin accused the BJP of betraying Tamil Nadu and highlighted the growth in non-'double engine' states. Modi, in turn, criticized the DMK government as 'Corruption, Mafia, Crime' and accused them of misgovernance and vote-bank politics.

description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon identified slow decision-making as his most significant career regret, emphasizing that "inertia has become an unforgivable sin" in today's rapidly evolving landscape. He highlighted the bank's aggressive AI adoption as a response to this urgency and the threat posed by agile fintech competitors.

title: Amazon preparing for another round of layoffs, thousands of jobs under scanner
description: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Big OpenAI worry: Google AI CEO's take on ChatGPT maker; thinks Sam Altman gets it
description: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue move. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.
